meanings.definition: To surpass in juggling skill or ability.
meanings.sent1: She outjuggles her friends by effortlessly juggling five balls at once.
meanings.sent2: The professional juggler outjuggles all the amateurs at the circus.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to outjuggle the magician, but ended up dropping all the balls.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outjuggle even the most experienced jugglers amazed the audience.
meanings.sent5: The way she outjuggles others makes it seem like she has an extra pair of hands.

meanings.definition: To outdo or outperform in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: In the talent show, she outjuggles her competitors with her impressive tricks.
meanings.sent2: The team captain always manages to outjuggle the opposing team's strategies.
meanings.sent3: He tried to outjuggle his rival in the game, but she was always one step ahead.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outjuggle everyone else on the field led her team to victory.
meanings.sent5: The way she outjuggles her opponents shows her dedication and hard work.
